text: I owe a post to outline how to transfer pull requests but Gerrit is all set to go
there is nothing in the repo
do we start from a clean slate?  i'd like that
<@U0XR6J961>, you must not be looking where you should
Will it work if I just `git remote add` the new repository at Gerrit to my existing local Fabric repo and make further pulls from it? (not needing to clone anything)
...Or maybe it's recommended to clone, since the paths will be different? (no more `$GOPATH\src\<http://github.com|github.com>` ?)

Did anyone check this out, by the way?
<http://gerrithub.io/>
Since we migrated to Gerrit, will the old repo on GitHub acting as a mirror repo (i.e. further commits will still be synced to GitHub) ?  Or it won't be updated anymore?

> The GH fabric repo will remain in read-only mode until we establish the mirror from Gerrit. We will preserve the current state of the hyperledger/fabric repo (and all subsequent transitioned repositories) for posterity at a location TBD (likely something like 'hyperledger-archive' org on GH).

Oh I see.
<@U1U7BR1KP>: there will need to be a distinct mirror from Gerrit to Github, because they don't share a common commit
I don't know if we will set the mirrors up under the same org or not. Everything is up in the air
